Based on your preference cues, I would recommend "The King's Speech" (2010) for you.
Plot Summary:
"The King's Speech" is a British comedy-drama film directed by Tom Hooper and released in the United Kingdom in April 2010.

It stars Colin Firth as King George VI, with Geoffrey Rush playing Lionel Logue, the speech therapist who helped the unsure monarch overcome his stammer.

The film was inspired by the true story of King George VI's journey to overcome his stutter.

The film received critical acclaim, winning a total of eight awards including Best Picture at the 84th Academy Awards.

conversation.text:
Based on your preferences, I would highly recommend watching "The Giver" and "Stand by Me". 

"The Giver" is a dystopian novel written by Lois Lowry in 1982. The story is set in a future society where all individuals are born into one of five genetic classes (A, B, C, D). In this society, the government controls everything, and people are not allowed to choose their own lifestyles or beliefs.

The main character, Jonas, is selected by the government to take on the role of the "cutter," who is responsible for taking the lives of新生儿 born into genetic class A.

Despite his fear and uncertainty about his new role as the cutter, Jonas ultimately accepts his assignment and takes his first life.

As Jonas progresses through his training as the cutter, he gradually becomes more detached and emotionless, until he finally reaches a point where he is completely numb and unresponsive to any external stimuli or emotional cues.
